channel.title: Console Hacks
channel.description: ok so i wuz just wondering how many people have "modified" Game consoles? Like do you have a mod chip? or a softmod? (softmod=software hack, for noobs :smiley: ) like i have a softmodded wii, and a flashed Xbox 360

item.title: Console Hacks
item.dc:creator: loony636
item.description:
ManlyStump:

I thought it was something like 99% of bricks you can recover from?

That 1% will be some kid who ran over his Wii with a car and then complained that BootMii wasn’t able to help him. Or someone who tried to delete the System Channel and then reinstall it with nothing but a Commodore 64 and large pieces of string.

Read full topic

item.title: Console Hacks
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
…something like 99%…

They just say that. It’s like saying black mesa is 99% awesome. Everyone knows it’s 100% but there is always that one kid that has to ruin it for everyone else.

Read full topic

item.title: Console Hacks
item.dc:creator: ManlyStump
item.description:
loony636:

Well, if you install BootMii then you should be able to recover your Wii from any bricking. Without Recovery Disks.

I thought it was something like 99% of bricks you can recover from?

Read full topic

item.title: Console Hacks
item.dc:creator: loony636
item.description:
Door:

Nintendo Recovery Disk. Only Nintendo have them though. :meh:

Well, if you install BootMii then you should be able to recover your Wii from any bricking. Without Recovery Disks.

item.dc:creator: SwampFox56
item.description:
(rot)(fodder:

that’s me right there. although I would need to be 100% sure I knew what i was doing and what the outcome would be if I ever tried. and I have absolutley no idea what I am doing so…

i made a video on how to softmod wii here

item.title: Console Hacks
item.dc:creator: FireTime
item.description:
I installed wii mod chips before soft modding was all the rage. Did 4-5 normals, and a couple grinders. (dremeling into the top of a micro chip was a little scary)

Read full topic

item.title: Console Hacks
item.dc:creator: punisher1565
item.description:
Door:

Nintendo Recovery Disk. Only Nintendo have them though. :meh:

I have an r4 in my ds (it’s awesome) and I’m planning on hacking my psp 100’s (one for me and one for a friend) with a pandora battery and a couple o’ 16 gb memory sticks.

otherwise I don’t have any mods, but I figure that if I get a job I might buy a wii (because they’re cheap) so i can modify it and get all the games I want!

Read full topic

item.title: Console Hacks
item.dc:creator: SwampFox56
item.description:
wii homebrew rocks!! I can play pirated cough, im mean backup gamecube games, and load all of my wii games onto a hard drive and play them right off of the hard drive

Read full topic

item.title: Console Hacks
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
bigfan421:

and they don’t take too kindly to users with Homebrew channel (matter of fact, every other Wii System Update destabilizes the last version of homebrew software)… so your best bet is to have a buddy in Nintendo’s Tech Support Dept.

You turn off updates when you get homebrew

Read full topic

item.title: Console Hacks
item.dc:creator: bigfan421
item.description:
From what I’ve read, Ramirezoid, Homebrew Channel for the Wii Is Software, not hardware…
So installation of any electronic components beyond insertion of an SD card into the slot in the system is unnecessary

Read full topic

item.title: Console Hacks
item.dc:creator: Ramirezoid
item.description:
I enjoy console gaming, my 360 hasn’t fucked up once in all the years I’ve had it, it’s the console gamers that are bothersome.

I was thinking about doing some shit to my Wii so that it can play Quake, but I know I’d end up bricking it because I fail at electronics.

Read full topic

item.title: Console Hacks
item.dc:creator: Schizophriend
item.description:
I have a modded 360. After going through 4 previous 360s I decided to get a gaming pc and mod my new 360. Fuck console gaming.

Read full topic

Door:

My Wii isn’t modded in any way… but looking at the homebrew channel makes me sadface that I haven’t softmodded it.

that’s me right there. although I would need to be 100% sure I knew what i was doing and what the outcome would be if I ever tried. and I have absolutley no idea what I am doing so…

item.title: Console Hacks
item.dc:creator: RabidMonkey
item.description:
I modded my 360 so I can keep backups of my games. It’s already come in handy twice since I’ve had the console damage not one but two of my original discs. Nothing wrong with modifying your console for legitimate purposes (if you don’t care about your warranty).

Read full topic

item.title: Console Hacks
item.dc:creator: Door
item.description:
mrfohlin:

I don’t think people around here liked flashed hardware or software.

Quite a few people here do have and like modded consoles.

My Wii isn’t modded in any way… but looking at the homebrew channel makes me sadface that I haven’t softmodded it.

Read full topic

item.title: Console Hacks
item.dc:creator: Grey_Acumen
item.description:
I used the software mod for my Wii. It’s really incredibly easy to do anymore. Just need an SD card for it. Quake plays hella awesome on it. Syobon Action is great too.

I generally don’t go for the hardware modded stuff though.

Read full topic
